"Directed with minimal flair by Mois√©s Kaufman, it will likely interest the nostalgic and few others. This is unfortunate because Fierstein has written a piece that peers deep into the gay soul...A director can tie these clashing pieces together with a bold vision, but that is exactly what is missing from Kaufman's good-enough staging...If those well-crafted performances were in a riskier production, this revival of 'Torch Song' might really grab hold of our collars."
